body:
### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [X] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: No, this concerns the UI.
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.25.1
- **Python version**: 3.8.10
- **Exact command to reproduce**: `mlflow ui --backend-store-uri "sqlite:///mlruns.db"`

### Describe the problem
Currently, in the MLFlow tracking UI metrics plot, when plotting around 100k points, the plot becomes unusably slow.

It appears like no simplification / decimation / subsampling strategy is used and all data points are simply rendered.

As I prefer to log metrics at all training steps, this is very problematic. Tensorboard, for example, subsamples the data points at the server-side, making plotting fast. This is configured via a [CLI argument](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/blob/348af4cf9564b8217750e8d84e0b2b89555be62c/tensorboard/data/server/cli.rs#L129).

The issue appears to lie in the rendering part, as the large JSON files containing all the metrics loads sufficiently fast.

Possible solutions:
- Subsample the data points server-side
- Subsample the data points client-side
- Use an adaptive method on the client side, such as https://github.com/predict-idlab/plotly-resampler 

### Tracking information
```
MLflow version: 1.25.1
Tracking URI: sqlite:///mlruns.db
```
```
mlflow ui --backend-store-uri "sqlite:///mlruns.db"
```

### Code to reproduce issue
Any plot with around 100k points.
